org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.datatransfer

Class PacketReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.datatransfer.PacketReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    @InterfaceAudience.Private
public class PacketReceiver
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Class to handle reading packets one-at-a-time from the wire. These packets are used both for reading and writing data to/from DataNodes.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_PACKET_SIZE

        private static final int MAX_PACKET_SIZE
        The max size of any single packet. This prevents OOMEs when invalid data is sent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG

        static final org.apache.commons.logging.Log LOG

      • bufferPool

        private static final org.apache.hadoop.util.DirectBufferPool bufferPool

      • useDirectBuffers

        private final boolean useDirectBuffers

      • curPacketBuf

        private ByteBuffer curPacketBuf
        The entirety of the most recently read packet. The first PKT_LENGTHS_LEN bytes of this buffer are the length prefixes.

      • curChecksumSlice

        private ByteBuffer curChecksumSlice
        A slice of curPacketBuf which contains just the checksums.

      • curDataSlice

        private ByteBuffer curDataSlice
        A slice of curPacketBuf which contains just the data.

      • curHeader

        private PacketHeader curHeader
        The packet header of the most recently read packet.

      • receiveNextPacket

        public void receiveNextPacket(ReadableByteChannel in)
                       throws IOException
        Reads all of the data for the next packet into the appropriate buffers. The data slice and checksum slice members will be set to point to the user data and corresponding checksums. The header will be parsed and set.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • receiveNextPacket
